title: How to calculate mass from moles - Quora

response.answer_text: There are 6.022×10^23 atoms per mole. It’s called Avogadro's number. Carbon weighs 12 grams per mole. Sodium weighs 23 grams per mole. Look at Periodic Table. Each element displays atomic weight. Carbon has atomic weight of 12. That’s weight for one Carbon atom. For a mole of carbon atoms, it is 12 grams.
moles=mass/molecular weight. If you want to calculate mass then you would use the following formula mass=moles*molecular weight (Note * denotes multiplication sign)
